concede.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to admit that something is true or correct, although you wish it were not true
concede.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: ‘That’s the only possible solution.’ ‘Yes, I suppose so, ’ Charles conceded.
I conceded that I had made a number of errors.
concede.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to admit that you are not going to win a game, argument, battle etc
concede.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: The Georgian forces defended the capital but were finally obliged to concede.
In May 1949, Stalin conceded defeat and reopened land access to Berlin.
concede.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to give something to someone as a right or privilege, often unwillingly
concede.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: The King finally agreed to concede further powers to Parliament.
Finally the company conceded wage increases to their workers.
